title: Bubbles in the affine Brauer and Kauffman categories
abstract:
We introduce a generating function approach to the affine Brauer and Kauffman
categories and show how it allows one to efficiently recover important sets of
relations in these categories. We use this formalism to deduce restrictions on
possible categorical actions and show how this recovers admissibility results
that have appeared in the literature on cyclotomic Birman-Murakami-Wenzl (BMW)
algebras and their degenerate versions, also known as cyclotomic Nazarov-Wenzl
algebras or VW algebras.
